medical: The tip of the endoscope was inserted in the rectum. Retroflexion of the tip of the endoscope failed to reveal any distal rectal lesions. The rest of the colon, through to the cecum, was well visualized. The cecal strap and ileocecal valve were both identified. There was no evidence of tumor, polyp, mass, ulceration, or other focus of inflammation. Adverse reactions none.
layman: The tip of the endoscope was inserted into the rectum. Bending the tip back (retroflexion) did not show any problems in the lower rectum. The rest of the colon, all the way to the cecum, was clearly seen. The cecal strap and ileocecal valve were both found. No signs of tumor, polyp, mass, ulcer, or inflammation were seen. No adverse reactions.
